name: nytimes
text:
RT @jimtankersley: My first dispatch from my burning home state, with words from the poet Kim Stafford: 

“Downwind from where the forest burns / we inhale the cindered souls of trees / that in a whoosh became particulate / and rode the wind to enter us.”

https://t.co/vMwwBnwIld
